# Creating the response variable

- absolute and relative evapotranspiration

\begin{align*}
aET &= (ET_{\text{burned,prefire}} - ET_{\text{burned,postfire}}) \\
    &\quad - (ET_{\text{control,prefire}} - ET_{\text{control,postfire}}) \\
rET &= \frac{aET}{ET_{\text{burned,prefire}}} \times 100 \%
\end{align*}

# Choosing covariates - initial MLR

- Use it all! no interactions
\begin{align*}
\text{rET} &= \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{pre-fire NDVI} + \beta_2 \cdot \text{dNBR} + \beta_3 \cdot \text{elevation}  \\
&\quad + \beta_4 \cdot \text{slope} + \beta_5 \cdot \text{aspect} \\
&\quad + \beta_6 \cdot \text{northness} + \beta_7 \cdot \text{latitude} \\
&\quad + \beta_8 \cdot \text{temperature} + \beta_9 \cdot \text{precipitation} + \epsilon \\
&\text{adjusted } R^2 = 0.5686 \\
\end{align*}

# MLR reduced model with interactions

- accounting for interactions improves the model
<!-- \begin{minipage}{0.2\linewidth} -->
<!-- \scriptsize % Make the text smaller -->
\begin{align*}
\text{rET} &= \beta_0 + \beta_1 \cdot \text{dNBR} + \beta_2 \cdot \text{latitude} \\
&\quad + \beta_3 \cdot \text{precipitation} + \beta_4 \cdot (\text{pre-fire NDVI} \cdot \text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + \beta_5 \cdot (\text{elevation} \cdot \text{dNBR}) + \beta_6 \cdot (\text{latitude} \cdot \text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + \beta_7 \cdot (\text{latitude} \cdot \text{precipitation}) + \epsilon \\
&\text{adjusted } R^2 = 0.6261 \\
\end{align*}
<!-- \end{minipage} -->
<!-- \hfill -->

# GAMs - more computational cost

<!-- \begin{minipage}{0.2\linewidth} -->
<!-- \scriptsize % Make the text smaller -->
\begin{align*}
\text{rET} &= \beta_0 + s_1(\text{pre-fire NDVI}) + s_2(\text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + s_3(\text{elevation}) + s_4(\text{slope}) \\
&\quad + s_5(\text{aspect}) + s_6(\text{northness})\\
&\quad + s_7(\text{latitude}) + s_8(\text{temperature}) \\
&\quad + s_9(\text{precipitation}) + \epsilon \\
&\text{adjusted } R^2 = 0.675 \\
\end{align*}

# GAM reduced model
<!-- \begin{minipage}{0.2\linewidth} -->
<!-- \scriptsize % Make the text smaller -->
\begin{align*}
\text{rET} &= \beta_0 + s_1(\text{dnbr}) + s_2(\text{lat}) + s_3(\text{precip}) \\
&\quad + te(\text{pre-fire NDVI}, \text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + te(\text{elevation}, \text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + te(\text{latitude}, \text{dNBR}) \\
&\quad + te(\text{latitude}, \text{precipitation}) + \epsilon \\
&\text{adjusted } R^2 = 0.695 \\
\end{align*}
